首里城火災、正殿１階の北側が火元か…電気系統のトラブルも視野

03 Nov 2019, 11:45

　那覇市の首里城で発生した火災で、出火直後に現場に駆けつけた複数の警備員が、正殿（せいでん）１階の北側付近で煙を確認していたことが、沖縄県警への取材でわかった。この場所には電気設備があり、県警は正殿１階の北側が火元とみて、電気系統のトラブルも視野に原因の特定を進めている。
　県警や那覇市消防局などによると、１日から始めた実況見分では、正殿北側を重点的に調べている。３日の見分では大きさ数メートルの電気設備を回収しており、今後、詳しく解析する。出火当時、正殿の中は無人だったとみられることから、県警は放火の可能性は低いとしている。
　火災が発生したのは１０月３１日未明。午前２時３４分、正殿に設置したセンサーが北側付近の異常を感知し、同３５分に警備員１人が施錠された北側のシャッターを開けて中に入ったところ、黒煙が充満していた。警備員はシャッターを開けたまま消火器を取りに行くため正殿を離れており、ここから風が吹き込んで火災が拡大した可能性もある。
　連絡を受けて駆けつけた別の警備員は、シャッター近くの窓の隙間から煙が出ているのを目撃した。同５３分に到着した警察官も北側が激しく燃えているのを確認した。実況見分では、瓦やがれきの燃え具合を採取場所ごとに確認し、炭化の程度などから出火した場所や原因を調べている。
　また、首里城を管理・運営する一般財団法人「沖縄美（ちゅ）ら島財団」によると、耐火性の収蔵庫２か所に保管されていた美術品約１０８０点が焼失を免れた。順次、美術品を運び出して損傷状況を調べる。

Shuri Castle Fire, the north side of the first floor of the main hall is the origin of fire.

03 Nov 2019, 11:45

Due to the fire that occurred at Shuri Castle in Naha City, several security guards rushed to the scene immediately after the fire had confirmed smoke near the north side of the first floor of the main shrine. I learned from the interview. There is electrical equipment at this place, and the prefectural police see the north side of the first floor of the main hall as the source of fire, and are trying to identify the cause of electric system troubles.
According to the prefectural police and the Naha City Fire Department, the north side of the main shrine has been focused on the actual situation starting on the 1st. In view of the 3rd day, we have recovered electrical equipment of several meters in size and will analyze it in detail in the future. At the time of the fire, the prefectural police said that the possibility of arson was low because the main shrine seems to have been unattended.
The fire broke out before October 31st. At 2:34 a.m., a sensor installed in the main hall sensed an abnormality near the north side, and in the same 35 minutes, a security guard opened the shutter on the north side and locked in. The black smoke was full. It was. The guards left the main hall to go to the fire extinguisher with the shutter open, and there was a possibility that the wind blown from here and the fire spread.
“Another security guard rushed in contact with the door and witnessed smoke coming out of the window near the shutter. A police officer who arrived at the same 53 minutes confirmed that the north side was burning violently. In the actual situation, the burning condition of roof tiles and debris is checked at each sampling location, and the location and cause of the fire are investigated from the degree of carbonization.
In addition, according to the Okinawa Foundation, which manages and operates Shuri Castle, about 1080 pieces of art stored in two fire-resistant storages were burned away. Sequentially carry out artworks and examine the damage situation.
